function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inadequate data privacy and security measures in smart city infrastructure could lead to unauthorized access to sensitive medical information.","category":"Privacy & Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Privacy, control, and propaganda issues arising from the implementation of smart and safe city concepts.","category":"Privacy & Control","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Security loopholes and threats posed by smart grid, automated building systems, unmanned aerial vehicles, and iot-enabled sensors.","category":"Security Threats","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of data leading to espionage and financial exploitation","category":"Security Vulnerability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear and discomfort among citizens due to surveillance and data privacy concerns","category":"Citizen Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heterogeneity of systems impacting trust in smart city concept","category":"System Trust","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consent for personal data processing in smart city systems","category":"Privacy & Consent","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance from the general public towards the coupling of smart city and safe city concepts.","category":"Public Resistance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential reliance on proprietary technology as an alternative to addressing privacy and security concerns in smart and safe cities.","category":"Technology Reliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased monitoring and management of human activities by corporate capitalism","category":"Corporate Monitoring","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased dependence on digital platforms due to covid-19, leading to social and cultural reformation","category":"Digital Dependence","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proliferation of smart city technology and 6g may lead to increased surveillance and privacy concerns","category":"Surveillance Proliferation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid advancements in ict and wireless technologies may result in disparities in digital access and broadband speeds","category":"Digital Disparities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor coverage in 1g technology","category":"1g Coverage","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low sound quality in 1g technology","category":"1g Sound Quality","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of roaming support capacity in 1g technology","category":"1g Roaming Support","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential health complications from 5g infrastructure installations","category":"5g Health Complications","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation related to the proliferation of social media and connectivity","category":"Disease Propagation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consistency in the definition of \\'smart cities\\' can lead to uncertainty and confusion in the implementation of smart city technologies and strategies, potentially hindering effective governance and urban development.","category":"Definition Consistency","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on private corporations for smart city development","category":"Corporate Reliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surveillance and monitoring by corporations and governance entities","category":"Corporate Surveillance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global cooperation and governance challenges in the face of corporate influence","category":"Global Governance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Monopolistic introduction of unique iot devices by corporations","category":"Monopolistic IoT","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Expensive infrastructure investment due to multiple device platforms","category":"Infrastructure Costs","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High implementation costs leading to abandonment or refocusing of the smart city pursuit","category":"Implementation Costs","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Major shift to at-home work and self-isolated society in developed countries","category":"Social Shift","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequitable access to digital services and technologies, exacerbating urban inequalities and infrastructure issues.","category":"Digital Access Inequality","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical presence in real-time operations may lead to delayed or inadequate response to health and safety hazards","category":"Real-time Operations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Remote operation and monitoring may lead to increased risk of contagion spread if proper health and safety measures are not implemented","category":"Remote Monitoring","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate policy and law formulation in urban planning due to lack of consideration for digital fluency and digital rich environments","category":"Policy Formulation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on old-school drawing culture and impersonal autocad representations due to contemporary addiction to digital narrative rich television shows and movies","category":"Drawing Culture","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential limitations in using 5g and 6g technologies for telemedicine, teleworking, and real-time communication in health sector","category":"Telecommunication Limitations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through increased physical interactions in urban areas and cities due to the use of xr technology.","category":"XR Contagion Spread","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases through shared holographic displays","category":"Holographic Transmission","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of infection due to crowded spaces around holographic displays","category":"Holographic Infection Risk","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of virus transmission through shared touch surfaces on holographic display interfaces","category":"Holographic Touch Transmission","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of high fidelity mobile holographic capability may lead to increased physical interaction and close proximity among individuals, potentially facilitating the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Mobile Holographic Interaction","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Integration of ai and big data in creating super datasets for urban fabrics may lead to data privacy and security risks, potentially exposing sensitive information to unauthorized individuals or entities.","category":"AI & Big Data Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to increased physical interaction in urban spaces and events.","category":"Urban Interaction Spread","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift towards less face-to-face human interactions due to the outbreak of covid-19","category":"Reduced Face-to-Face Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid shift to digital technology in architecture education","category":"Architecture Education Shift","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Globalization of design studios and classes","category":"Globalized Design Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Slowdown in technology advancements due to covid-19 pandemic","category":"Technology Slowdown","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on smart wireless devices in urban areas","category":"Wireless Device Reliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty about future pandemics","category":"Pandemic Uncertainty","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic impact of infectious diseases","category":"Infectious Disease Impact","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential reliance on unproven technology for virus inactivation","category":"Unproven Technology Reliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective antiviral drug and vaccine","category":"Antiviral Lack","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Escalating inequality due to the pandemic","category":"Inequality Escalation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to lack of quarantine measures","category":"Quarantine Impact","confidence":"High"}]}
